page.title: 12TWYFORD (ROMANO-BRITISH)
page.content: THIS SITE CALLED BLACKLANDS IS 3/4 OF A MILE NORTH OF KINGS SUTTON AND 3 MILES SOUTH-EAST OF BANBURY.THE NAME IS THOUGHT TO HAVE COME FROM THE VERY DARK COLOUR OF THE SOIL.IT IS SITUATED ON A HILL WITH A VIEW DOWN THE CHERWELL VALLEY.THE TOTAL SITE IS BETWEEN 20 AND 30 ACRES.AN OLD ROAD CROSSES THE SITE AND THE RIVER CHERWELL AT TWYFORD (TWO FORDS?). FINDS ON THE SITE HAVE INCLUDED SEVERAL SKELETONS,URNS,FOUNDATION WALLS AND COINS.THE COINS MADE OF BRASS,SILVER AND BASE METALS ARE LOCALLY KNOWN AS "BLACKLAND PENCE". IT WOULD SEEM LIKELY THAT THE BUILDINGS ON THIS SITE WOULD HAVE HAD THATCHED ROOVES,WOODEN WALLS AND STONE FOUNDATIONS.THEY MAY HAVE BEEN DESTROYED BY FIRE.
